structs.name: OperationalTrafficPlan
structs.info: Defines a container class for all OperationalPlans

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovements
attrs.info: Composes of operational plan movements

attrs.name: operationalPlanRestrictions
attrs.info: Composes of operational plan restrictions

attrs.name: operationalPlanWarningMeasures
attrs.info: Composes of operational plan warning measures

structs.name: OperationalPlanMovement
structs.info: Defines a train run with a dedicated train number.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: configurationDataVersionRef
attrs.info: Defines the configuration data version for which the operational plan is valid

attrs.name: includesEndOfJourney
attrs.info: Defines if the operational plan movement include the end of journey. if true, the movementEvents contains entire remaining path including the end position, otherwise the journey will continue after the last movementEvent of this object

attrs.name: operationalTrainUnits
attrs.info: Defines the set of train units, which are active during some paths of the train movement. The same train unit can be used in not connected parts of the path

attrs.name: movementEvents
attrs.info: Defines times/operational activities sequence along the movement

attrs.name: movementRestrictions
attrs.info: Defines train specific restrictions, which are active along its path-sections

structs.name: TrainUnit
structs.info: Defines rolling stock, which is used to implement part of a train movement.

attrs.name: physicalTrainUnit
attrs.info: Defines the physical train unit to be used in Plan Execution user interface of Workbench (fallback level for TMS)

attrs.name: operationalTrainCategory
attrs.info: Defines the category type for the train in operational plan. To be used inPlan Execution user interface of Workbench (fallback level for TMS)

attrs.name: operationalConsists
attrs.info: Defines operational consists building the TrainUnit starting from the train-head.

attrs.name: nominalRotatingMass
attrs.info: Defines the nominal rotating mass of the train,special value 0=unknown

attrs.name: regularBrakeWeightPercentage
attrs.info: Defines the regular brake weight percentage. Use 0 if undefined

attrs.name: emergencyBrakeWeightPercentage
attrs.info: Defines the emergency brake weight percentage. Use zero if undefined

attrs.name: brakePosition
attrs.info: Defines the active brake position for the train

attrs.name: brakeModelType
attrs.info: Defines the applicable brake model type for the train

attrs.name: atoGradeAutomation
attrs.info: Defines the ato grade of automation for the train

attrs.name: scheduledTrainLength
attrs.info: Defines the scheduled train length in meters

structs.name: OperationalTrainCategory
structs.info: Defines usage category for an OperationalTrain

attrs.name: description
attrs.info: Defines the description for the operational train categoryfor UI-purposes

attrs.name: trainUsage
attrs.info: Defines the train usage type for UI-purposes

structs.name: OperationalConsist
structs.info: Defines a rolling-stock consist unit identified by the installed onboard equipment.

attrs.name: supportedOnBoardEquipment
attrs.info: Defines the list of supported onboard equipment for an operational consist

structs.name: SupportedOnBoardEquipment
structs.info: Defines Onboard equipment installed and active on a train

attrs.name: trainProtectionType
attrs.info: Defines the train protection type supported by the on board equipment

attrs.name: etcsSystemVersions
attrs.info: Defines the supported etcs system versions

structs.name: OnBoardExtension
structs.info: A container class for a non-standard key-value-property. Messages need sometimes IM-specific information.

attrs.name: contentType
attrs.info: Defines the key-attribute in a key-value-pair. Used for annotation of IM-specific onboard-equipment

attrs.name: content
attrs.info: Defines the value-attribute in a key-value-pair. Used for annotation of IM-specific onboard-equipment

structs.name: MovementRestriction
structs.info: Defines train specific restriction along its path.

attrs.name: restrictedPath
attrs.info: Defines the restricted path associated to a restriction of on an operational plan movement

attrs.name: specificRestriction
attrs.info: Defines the specific restriction active on the restriction path associated to an operational plan movement

structs.name: SpecificMovementRestriction
structs.info: Defines single aspect of the train specific restriction

attrs.name: maxSpeed
attrs.info: Defines the maximum applicable speed

attrs.name: adhesionCategory
attrs.info: Defines the different adhesion categories applicable for the train as per track conditions

attrs.name: maxCurrent
attrs.info: Defines max current value, s. item 0.33 in SS126

attrs.name: atoInhibition
attrs.info: train section is not contantly monitored, or stimulate driver's attention, or approaching overcrouded station

attrs.name: dasInhibition
attrs.info: Defines the Driver advisory system inhibition zone

attrs.name: excludedDPSGroupsForFlankProtection
attrs.info: Defines the list of DPSGroups to be excluded from flank protection calculation.

structs.name: DPSGroupsList
structs.info: Defines a set of Drive-Protection-Section-Groups

attrs.name: dpsGroups
attrs.info: Defines the list of DPS Groups

structs.name: MovementEvent
structs.info: Defines an operational activity on a specific point in space and time for a train run.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: plannedType
attrs.info: Defines if stop or pass was planned

attrs.name: scheduledType
attrs.info: Defines if stop or pass is scheduled

attrs.name: alignment
attrs.info: Defines the train-alignment at position (head, center, end)

attrs.name: position
attrs.info: Defines position on a linearElement for the movement event

attrs.name: pathToNextEvent
attrs.info: Defines the path-part after the LinearElement of the position-value. Must be provided in each MovementEvent except the last one.

attrs.name: stopDescription
attrs.info: Defines the stop description in case of a stop of the train

attrs.name: scheduledArrival
attrs.info: Defines the scheduled arrival time. equal to scheduledDeparture for a passing train, see latestArrival inSS126. In the first station it is time of 'start of mission', in UTC

attrs.name: scheduledArrivalWindow
attrs.info: Defines the scheduled arrival window. scheduledEaliestArrival = scheduledArrival - scheduledArrivalWindow. For passing trains scheduledEarliestDeparture = scheduledEarliestArrival, see arrivalWindow in SS126. In the first station it is a time window for 'start of mission'.

attrs.name: startsAfterEvents
attrs.info: Defines the set of operational events, which must be finished before the current event starts.

structs.name: OperationalEventRef
structs.info: Defines a reference to one of possible OperationalEvents (as a unit)

attrs.name: movementEvent
attrs.info: refers a movement event including the movement plan

attrs.name: restrictionEvent
attrs.info: Refers a restriction event including restriction plan

attrs.name: warningMeasureEvent
attrs.info: Refers a warnning measure event including the warning plan

structs.name: StopDescription
structs.info: Defines activities to be implemented by the train when it stopps.

attrs.name: trainUnitActivities
attrs.info: Defines the sequence of changes of TrainUnit during the stop

attrs.name: doorActivity
attrs.info: Defines the door activity. If the attribute is not provided, the doors remain closed

attrs.name: relaxedCoupler
attrs.info: Defines the state of coupler. true - request for coupler relaxation, false -not, see Q_Relaxed_Coupler in SS126

attrs.name: holdTrain
attrs.info: Defines, that if the train shall be hold until the next update. See JP in SS126

attrs.name: scheduledDeparture
attrs.info: Defines the scheduled departure time. see departure in SS126. In the last station it is 'end of mission', in UTC.

attrs.name: scheduledMinDwellTime
attrs.info: Defines if the train has to wait after actual arrival this number of seconds before departure. ActualEarliestDeparture = max(departure, arrival + minDwellTime) will be calculated by ATO-OB, see minDwellTime in SS126

attrs.name: additionalEventTimes
attrs.info: Defines the state of coupler. true - request for coupler relaxation, false -not, see Q_Relaxed_Coupler in SS126

structs.name: AdditionalEventTime
structs.info: Definestimes not required for ATO, but useful for CDAS (e.g. published arrival, plannedArrival etc.)

attrs.name: timeValue
attrs.info: Defines the time value in UTC

attrs.name: timeType
attrs.info: Defines the time type for a stop description

structs.name: DoorActivity
structs.info: Defines which doors shall be open and how they shall be open.

attrs.name: openingDoorSide
attrs.info: Defines the door opening side. noneSide if the doors are kept closed.noneSide if the doors are kept closed

attrs.name: centralisedOpening
attrs.info: Defines if the doors can be centrally opened. true - centralised opening, false - opening by passengers/driver

attrs.name: automaticClosing
attrs.info: Defines if automatic closing of doors is performed by ATO or not. True by ATO, false - without ATO

structs.name: TrainUnitActivity
structs.info: Defines, what happens with the rolling stock at this location.

attrs.name: trainUnitActivityType
attrs.info: Defines the train unit activity type

attrs.name: actualTrainUnitIndex
attrs.info: Defines the index of TrainUnit in OperationalMovement. operationalTrainUnits before the activity

attrs.name: targetTrainUnitIndex
attrs.info: Defines the index of TrainUnit in OperationalMovement. operationalTrainUnits after the activity

structs.name: PhysicalTrainUnitIdentifier
structs.info: Defines a set of possible identifiers for a physical train (ETCS-trainRunningNumber, OBU-ID etc).

attrs.name: trainRunningNumber
attrs.info: Defines the Train Running Number for ETCS same as SS026.NID_OPERATIONAL. To be usable for ETCS must contain a decimal number [0..99999999]. Mapping to uint32 by filling with F: '1233' -> 0x1233FFFF

attrs.name: additionalTrainRunningNumber
attrs.info: Defines the distinction between Operational Train Units with the same trainRunningNumber. This may occur if a trainRunningNumber is reused for different spare trains.

attrs.name: tafTapTsiTrainID
attrs.info: refers to taf tap tsi train id

attrs.name: leadingOnBoardUnitId
attrs.info: Defines NID_ENGINE. To be usable with ETCS must contain a decimal number [0..16.777.215]

structs.name: OperationalPlanRestriction
structs.info: Defines a temporary infrastructure restriction

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: configurationDataVersionRef
attrs.info: Defines the configuration data version for which the operational plan is valid

attrs.name: restrictionEvents
attrs.info: Defines a set of restriction events assigned the the operational plan restriction

structs.name: RestrictionEvent
structs.info: Defines a part of temporary infrastructure restriction, especially if one Restriction plan contains several areas to be activate to different times.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: creationTime
attrs.info: Defines the time when the restrictionArea shall be created=implemented=activated in interlocking, in UTC

attrs.name: removalTime
attrs.info: Defines the removal time in UTC

attrs.name: restrictionArea
attrs.info: Defines the restriction area associated to a restriction event

attrs.name: startsAfterEvents
attrs.info: Defines the set of operational events, which must be finished before the current event starts.

structs.name: RestrictionArea
structs.info: Defines a topological area, in which the restrictions must be applied.

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of linear element sections

attrs.name: specificRestrictions
attrs.info: Defines the list of specific restrictions

structs.name: TrainGroupSpec
structs.info: Defines the train aspects, which define if the train belongs to the restricted group.

attrs.name: axleLoadCategories
attrs.info: Trains with the listed Axle-Load-Category belong to the TrainGroup.

attrs.name: cantDeficiencyCategories
attrs.info: Defines the different cant deficiency categories

structs.name: RestrictedAspect
structs.info: Defines single aspects of the infrastructure restriction

attrs.name: temporarySpeedRestriction
attrs.info: Defines the temporary speed restriction on the track

attrs.name: allowedDrivingModes
attrs.info: Defines the allowed driving modes

attrs.name: nonStopping
attrs.info: Defines the non stopping area. if true, the trains defined in trainGroupSpec shall not stop within restriction area

attrs.name: trackClosure
attrs.info: Defines track closure information. If true, the trains defined in trainGroupSpec shall not enter restriction area

attrs.name: operationalRadioHole
attrs.info: Defines the presence of operational radio holes. if true radio communication is restricted within restriction area

attrs.name: maxAdhesion
attrs.info: Defines the maximum adhesion

attrs.name: atoInhibition
attrs.info: Defined the ato inhibition zones. Exmaples: train section is not contantly monitored, or stimulate driver's attention, or approaching overcrouded station

attrs.name: maxCurrent
attrs.info: Defines max current value. For ATO, SS126. Ignored by TrafficCS

structs.name: SpecificRestriction
structs.info: Defines single aspect of the infrastructure restriction.

attrs.name: appliedToTrains
attrs.info: Defines the applicable trains that are affected by the specific restriction

attrs.name: restrictedAspects
attrs.info: Defines the restricted aspects associated to a specific restriction

structs.name: OperationalPlanWarningMeasure
structs.info: Defines a temporary warning area, required for e.g. a possession.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: configurationDataVersionRef
attrs.info: Defines the configuration data version for which the operational plan is valid

attrs.name: warningMeasureEvents
attrs.info: Defines the list of warning measures events

structs.name: WarningArea
structs.info: Defines area in which Warning measures shall be implemented.

attrs.name: trackArea
attrs.info: protected area

attrs.name: warningDevices
attrs.info: Defines the list of warning devices

structs.name: WarningDevice
structs.info: Defines functional warning device which must be activated to implement warning measure

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: deviceType
attrs.info: Defines a functional warning device type used for securing the warning area

structs.name: WarningMeasureEvent
structs.info: Defines planned activation/removal of warning area

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: creationTime
attrs.info: Defines the time when the warningArea shall be created=implemented=activated in interlocking, in UTC

attrs.name: removalTime
attrs.info: Defines the removal time in UTC

attrs.name: startsAfterEvents
attrs.info: Defines the set of operational events, which must be finished before the current event starts.

structs.name: ExecutionResponse
structs.info: Defines the result of evaluation of an operational plan from the TrafficCS (accepts/rejects)

attrs.name: operationalPlanRef
attrs.info: Refers to an operational plan

attrs.name: operationalPlanIssuedAt
attrs.info: refers to the issuedAt-value of the operational plan request, in UTC

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: responseCode
attrs.info: Defines the respose code associated the event execution request

attrs.name: rejectReason
attrs.info: Defines the reject reason for an event execution request

structs.name: OperationalPlanReference
structs.info: Defines a reference to one of possible OperationalPlans (movement, restriction, warning)

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovementRef
attrs.info: Refers the operational plan movement

attrs.name: operationalPlanRestrictionRef
attrs.info: Refers the operational plan restriction

attrs.name: operationalPlanWarningMeasureRef
attrs.info: Refers the operational plan warning measure

structs.name: EventExecutionReport
structs.info: Defines states of start/end of an event (success/failure, timestamp etc.)

attrs.name: arrivalReport
attrs.info: Defines the arrival reports. For passing only the departure reports are to be sent

attrs.name: departureReport
attrs.info: Defines the result of departure attempt

attrs.name: creationRestrictionReport
attrs.info: Defines the result of creation of a restriction

attrs.name: removalRestrictionReport
attrs.info: Defines the result of removal of a restriction

attrs.name: creationWarningMeasureReport
attrs.info: Defines the result of creation of a warning measure

attrs.name: removalWarningMeasureReport
attrs.info: Defines the result of removal of warning measure

structs.name: MovementEventExecutionReport
structs.info: Defines state of execution of a warning measure event (completed, failed, warning).

attrs.name: movementEvent
attrs.info: refers to a movement event. In json is a string with planId/eventId

attrs.name: operationalPlanIssuedAt
attrs.info: in UTC

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: executionState
attrs.info: Defines the type of execution result of the event

attrs.name: failureReason
attrs.info: Defines an informal error message in English

attrs.name: warning
attrs.info: Defines an informal warning message in English

structs.name: RestrictionEventExecutionReport
structs.info: Defines how the restriction event was executed (success, failure ...)

attrs.name: restrictionEvent
attrs.info: refers to a restriction event including operational plan restriction

attrs.name: operationalPlanIssuedAt
attrs.info: in UTC

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: executionState
attrs.info: Defines the type of execution result of the event

attrs.name: failureReason
attrs.info: Defines an informal error message in English

attrs.name: warning
attrs.info: Defines an informal warning message in English

attrs.name: warningMeasureEvent
attrs.info: in json is a string with planId/eventId

attrs.name: operationalPlanIssuedAt
attrs.info: in UTC

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: iDefines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: executionState
attrs.info: Defines the type of execution result of the event

attrs.name: failureReason
attrs.info: Defines an informal error message in English

attrs.name: warning
attrs.info: Defines an informal warning message in English

structs.name: TrainUnitReportPE
structs.info: Defines train report (position, capabilities, permission) coming from PlanExecution system.

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovement
attrs.info: Refers to the operational plan movement. If the new train was created in TrafficCS it does not have an operationalPlan (Movement) yet

attrs.name: cmdTrainObject
attrs.info: Defines the train object information

structs.name: TrainObject
structs.info: Defines a train report generated by TrafficCS including its position, length, speed etc.

attrs.name: obuIdentifier
attrs.info: Defines the onboard-unit identifier

attrs.name: movementPermission
attrs.info: Defines the movement permission for the train

attrs.name: trainLength
attrs.info: Defines the train length

attrs.name: safeTrainLength
attrs.info: Defines if the trainLength-value is safe

attrs.name: communicationActive
attrs.info: Defines the communication state for the train object

attrs.name: trainRunningNumber
attrs.info: see PhysicalTrainUnitIdentifier.trainRunningNumber

attrs.name: vMaxTrain
attrs.info: Defines maximum train speed

attrs.name: onboardOperatingMode
attrs.info: Defines the on-board operating mode of the train

attrs.name: trainLocation
attrs.info: Defines the position of the entire train (i.e., from rear to front) including the confidence intervals

attrs.name: trainObjectIdentifier
attrs.info: Generated by TrainProtectionSystem. It can generate two different trainObjectIds for the same physical train after it disappeared in a radio hole and appeared again.

attrs.name: mpRequestedByTrain
attrs.info: Defines the train object identifier. Generated by TrainProtectionSystem. It can generate two different trainObjectIds for the same physical train after it disappeared in a radio hole and appeared again.

attrs.name: currentSpeed
attrs.info: Defines current speed of the train

structs.name: MovementPermission
structs.info: Defines path and speed profiles assigned to a train for its next movement.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: riskBuffer
attrs.info: Defines the risk buffer for a movement permission =overlap after MP

attrs.name: riskPaths
attrs.info: Defines flank protection area on the neighbouring tracks

attrs.name: pathWay
attrs.info: Definesthe linear extent of the MA as in actual path of the train

attrs.name: movementModes
attrs.info: Defines applicable movement modes

attrs.name: speeds
attrs.info: Defines the maximum applicable speeds for the movement permission

structs.name: MpSpeed
structs.info: Defines speed-restriction section of the path defined in a movement permission.

attrs.name: vMax
attrs.info: Defines the maximum applicable speed for movement permission along the assigned path

attrs.name: path
attrs.info: refers the applicable path

structs.name: MpDrivingMode
structs.info: Defines inside of a movement permission, which parts of the reserved path can be driven in which ETCS mode.

attrs.name: drivingMode
attrs.info: Defines the applicable driving mode along the associated path

attrs.name: path
attrs.info: refers the applicable path

structs.name: TrainUnitReportAtoStatus
structs.info: Defines train position report from ATO with additional info (driverId, speed, etc.). Source is SS126.STR.

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovement
attrs.info: Refers to the operational plan movement. If the new train was created in TrafficCS it does not have an operationalPlan (Movement) yet

attrs.name: atoState
attrs.info: Defines the current ATO On-Board state

attrs.name: routingError
attrs.info: Defines if a routing error has occured (inconsistent path)

attrs.name: nextStoppingPointSkip
attrs.info: Defines the wish of the train driver to skip the next stop.

attrs.name: lowAdhesionReportedByDriver
attrs.info: Defines any low adhesion is reported by the driver

attrs.name: operationalConditionsFulfillment
attrs.info: Defines if the operational conditions are fullfilled for ATO

attrs.name: isMoving
attrs.info: Defines if the train is moving or not (v != 0)

attrs.name: unableToStopAtNextStoppingPoint
attrs.info: Defines if the the train is too close and/or too fast for stopping

attrs.name: isSlipping
attrs.info: Defines if the wheel slip occurs.bit7 from SS126

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: current speed of the train

attrs.name: trainLength
attrs.info: Defines the train length

attrs.name: driverId
attrs.info: Defines the driver id for the train unit

attrs.name: frontPosition
attrs.info: Defines the train front position with respect to the track edge direction. This direction can be deduced from JP and STR in SS 126

attrs.name: eventHandling
attrs.info: defines how the previous event was handled

attrs.name: eventEstimations
attrs.info: Refers to event estimations

structs.name: EventHandling
structs.info: Defines, how the previous event was handled.

attrs.name: event
attrs.info: refers a movement event including the movement plan

attrs.name: passStopDepart
attrs.info: Defines the result of the event handling action

structs.name: EventEstimation
structs.info: Defines forecast for events coming from ATO-Onboard

attrs.name: event
attrs.info: refers a movement event including the movement plan

attrs.name: arrival
attrs.info: Defines the arrival time in UTC

structs.name: TrainUnitReportAtoCapabilities
structs.info: Defines train capabilities reported by ATO from the train.

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovement
attrs.info: Refers to the operational plan movement. If the new train was created in TrafficCS it does not have an operationalPlan (Movement) yet

attrs.name: mass
attrs.info: train mass including load, 0 if unknown

attrs.name: outsideTemperature
attrs.info: Defines the outside temperature. Use 127 if unknown

attrs.name: etcsData
attrs.info: Defines the valid ETCS Data for the train. Not provided if invalid

attrs.name: passengerLoad
attrs.info: 255 unknown

attrs.name: lastPassengerExchangeTime
attrs.info: 65535: unknown

attrs.name: elapsedStartPassengerExchange
attrs.info: Defines the time elapsed between standstill and the doors are released for operation or opening; 4096: unknown

attrs.name: additionalTrainData
attrs.info: Defines additional train data as part of ATO capabilities report

attrs.name: physicalConsists
attrs.info: Defines the list of physical consists. Empty if unknown

structs.name: EtcsDataAto
structs.info: Defines static train capability data reported by ATO

attrs.name: trainLength
attrs.info: Defines the train length,0 if unknown

attrs.name: maximumSpeed
attrs.info: Defines the maximum applicable speed, use 0 if unknown

attrs.name: cantDeficiencyCategory
attrs.info: Defines the cant deficiency category of the train

attrs.name: otherInternationalCategory
attrs.info: Defines other international train categories

attrs.name: nominalRotatingMass
attrs.info: relates to total train weight. 16 if unknown

attrs.name: brakePercentage
attrs.info: Defines the brake percentage. 255 if unknown

attrs.name: preconfiguredBrakingModel
attrs.info: Defines preconfigured braking model for the train. Use 255 if unknown

attrs.name: brakePosition
attrs.info: Defines the active brake position for the train

structs.name: DoorData
structs.info: Defines availability of a door and last open time.

attrs.name: doorState
attrs.info: Defines the door state

attrs.name: lastPassengerExchangeTime
attrs.info: Defines the last passenger exchange time. Use 65535 if unknown

structs.name: AdditionalTrainData
structs.info: Defines dynamic train characteristics, which are not primary for the timetable (therefore 'additional')

attrs.name: maxAvailableTractiveEffort
attrs.info: Defines the maximun available traction effort. Use 65535 if unknown

attrs.name: maxAvailableTractivePower
attrs.info: Defines the maximun available traction power. Use 65535 if unknown

attrs.name: maxAvailableDynamicBrakeForce
attrs.info: Defines the maximun available dynamic brake force. Use 65535 if unknown

attrs.name: maxAvailableDynamicBrakePower
attrs.info: Defines the maximun available dynamic brake power. Use 65535 if unknown

attrs.name: maxAvailableServiceBrakeForce
attrs.info: Defines the maximun available service brake force. Use 65535 if unknown

attrs.name: regenerativeBrakeState
attrs.info: Defines the state of the regenerative brake

attrs.name: magneticShoeBrakeState
attrs.info: Defines the state of magnetic shoe brake

attrs.name: eddyCurrentBrakeState
attrs.info: Defines the state of eddy current brake

attrs.name: electroPneumaticBrakeState
attrs.info: Defines the state of electro pneumatic brake

attrs.name: adhesionIndependentBrakeState
attrs.info: Defines the adhesion independent brake state

attrs.name: availableAdhesionCategory
attrs.info: Defines the available adhesion categories;053 in Subset

attrs.name: availableAdhesionPhysicalValue
attrs.info: Defines the available adhesion value. 600 if unknown

structs.name: PhysicalConsist
structs.info: Defines an un-splittable part of the train

attrs.name: evnIdentifier
attrs.info: Defines the european vehicle number (EVN) 12 digits,use 0 if unknown

attrs.name: passengerLoad
attrs.info: Defines hte passenger load. Use 255 if unknown

attrs.name: mass
attrs.info: Defines the train mass including load. Use 0 if unknown

attrs.name: maxCurrentConsuption
attrs.info: Defines the maximun current consumption. Use 1023 if unknown

attrs.name: physicalVehicles
attrs.info: Defines the physical vehicles part of the physical consist. empty=unknown

structs.name: PhysicalVehicle
structs.info: Defines a single carrige inside of a physical consist.

attrs.name: evnIdentifier
attrs.info: European vehicle number (EVN) [2018/1614/EU] 12 digits, 0: unknown

attrs.name: mass
attrs.info: 2047: unknown

attrs.name: vehicleOrientation
attrs.info: Defines the orientation of the vehicle with respect to the train unit

attrs.name: doorDataLeft
attrs.info: Defines the left door data. Left is with respect of normal orientation

attrs.name: doorDataRight
attrs.info: Defines the right door data. Right is with respect of normal orientation

attrs.name: passengerLoad
attrs.info: 255=unknown

attrs.name: pantographsStates
attrs.info: Defines the state of the pantograph

structs.name: TrackOccupationState
structs.info: sent by low-level system on each track occupation registered, contains CMD.UnresolvedTrackboundObject

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Defines the Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovement
attrs.info: Refers to the operational plan movement. if the new train was created in TrafficCS it does not have an operationalPlan (Movement) yet

attrs.name: trainUnitIdentifier
attrs.info: Defines the train unit identifier

attrs.name: occupationState
attrs.info: Defines the occupation state of the track

attrs.name: creationReason
attrs.info: Defines the creation reason

attrs.name: recordedTrainLength
attrs.info: Defines the recorded train length. Use 0 if undefined

attrs.name: trackArea
attrs.info: composes of net area reference

attrs.name: associatedTrainObject
attrs.info: Defines the trainObjectId defined in MovementPermission

structs.name: DpsGroupState
structs.info: Define drivability state of a drive protection section

attrs.name: dpsGroup
attrs.info: refers to dpsGroup

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: operationalPlanMovement
attrs.info: Refers to the operational plan movement. if the new train was created in TrafficCS it does not have an operationalPlan (Movement) yet

attrs.name: dpsgState
attrs.info: common state of the drive protection section group

attrs.name: dpsStates
attrs.info: Defines the states of drive protection sections

structs.name: DPSState
structs.info: Defines state of a drive protection section

attrs.name: dps
attrs.info: refers to drive protection section

attrs.name: requestedDrivability
attrs.info: up to the operator, in accordance with the equipment manual

attrs.name: currentDrivability
attrs.info: Defines the current drivability states for DPS

structs.name: RestrictionAreaState
structs.info: Defines if the restriction is activated(created)/removed

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: id of restrictionArea generated by interlocking

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: restrictionEvent
attrs.info: refers to planned restriction event inclusive the operational plan restriction

attrs.name: restrictionState
attrs.info: Defines if the area was created or removed

attrs.name: restrictionArea
attrs.info: Defines the restriction area associated to a restriction area state. Provided if created by PE or implemented differently than planned

structs.name: WarningAreaState
structs.info: Defines the state of a WarningMeasureEvent (created/updated/removed).

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: warningArea-id generated by interlocking

attrs.name: issuedAt
attrs.info: Defines the issue-point in time with microsecond-precision builds a version-id for acknowledgements and validity-estimations, in UTC

attrs.name: warningMeasureEvent
attrs.info: refers to planned warning measure event (if planned)

attrs.name: warningState
attrs.info: Defines if the warning area was established or removed

attrs.name: warningArea
attrs.info: Defines the warning area associated with the warning area state. Provided if differs from warningMeasureEvent.warningArea or unplanned

enumLiterals.name: notInService
enumLiterals.info: betriebsfahrt

enumLiterals.name: breakdownTrain
enumLiterals.info: Hilfszug

enumLiterals.name: dryRailHigh
enumLiterals.info: Conditions where 100% of thebrake force of the vehicle can be appliedwith no axle sliding of more than2% (adhesion level typically above 0.15µ)

enumLiterals.name: dryRailMedium
enumLiterals.info: Conditions where the wheel/railadhesion is in the range 0.15 â 0.10 (Damprails with some contamination)

enumLiterals.name: dryRailLow
enumLiterals.info: Conditions where thewheel/rail adhesion is in the range 0.10 â0.08 (Typical autumn mornings due todew/dampness often combined with lightovernight rust)

enumLiterals.name: lowAdhesion
enumLiterals.info: Conditions where thewheel/rail adhesion is in the range 0.08 â0.05

enumLiterals.name: veryLowAdhesion
enumLiterals.info: Conditions where thewheel/rail adhesion is in the range 0.05-0.03

enumLiterals.name: extremelyLowAdhesion
enumLiterals.info: Conditionswhere the wheel/rail adhesion is below 0.03

enumLiterals.name: pass
enumLiterals.info: if the speed != 0 at the movement event position

enumLiterals.name: stop
enumLiterals.info: if the speed == 0 at the movement event position

enumLiterals.name: joinActivity
enumLiterals.info: uncouple vehicles/parts for self-propelling train parts

enumLiterals.name: splitActivity
enumLiterals.info: uncouple vehicles/parts for self-propelling train parts

enumLiterals.name: collectActivity
enumLiterals.info: couple vehicles/parts

enumLiterals.name: dropActivity
enumLiterals.info: uncouple vehicles/trainParts

enumLiterals.name: turnAroundActivity
enumLiterals.info: stop to change driving direction of a train. After TurnAround a new MovementEvent with changed train position will be inserted into the Movement

enumLiterals.name: meetActivity
enumLiterals.info: Relevant for PE to request restricted MP in advance

enumLiterals.name: otherActivity
enumLiterals.info: the change must be calculated by comparing TrainUnits before and after the activity

enumLiterals.name: CO
enumLiterals.info: State Configuration

enumLiterals.name: NA
enumLiterals.info: State Not Available

enumLiterals.name: AV
enumLiterals.info: State Available

enumLiterals.name: RE
enumLiterals.info: State Ready

enumLiterals.name: EG
enumLiterals.info: State Engaged

enumLiterals.name: DE
enumLiterals.info: State Disengaged

enumLiterals.name: FA
enumLiterals.info: State Failure

enumLiterals.name: doorStateBlocked
enumLiterals.info: defect

enumLiterals.name: pantographBlocked
enumLiterals.info: can not be used, defect

enums.name: DpsgState
enums.info: States of drive protection section group

enumLiterals.name: ready
enumLiterals.info: Associated Switchable Trackside Asset is not executing commands, connection health is good and switchable trackside asset is operationally good

enumLiterals.name: processing
enumLiterals.info: Associated Switchable Trackside Asset is currently executing a command, connection health is good and switchable trackside asset is operationally good . It is still possible to issue another set command to reverse the movement.

enumLiterals.name: disturbed
enumLiterals.info: Either the connection health is not good or the associated Switchable Trackside Asset is in an operationally disturbed state

enums.name: DpsDrivability
enums.info: drivability of a drive protection section
